agenda.description: SENATE NOTICE OF PUBLIC HEARING COMMITTEE: Business & Commerce TIME & DATE: 8:00 AM, Tuesday, March 19, 2019 PLACE: E1.012 (Hearing Room) CHAIR: Senator Kelly Hancock To be considered: SB 14 Nichols | et al. Relating to use of an electric cooperative's easements or property for broadband service. SB 454 Hughes Relating to the deployment of advanced metering and meter information networks in certain areas outside of ERCOT. SB 475 Hancock Relating to an advisory body on the security of the electric grid. SB 512 Rodríguez Relating to the deployment of advanced metering and meter information networks in certain areas outside of ERCOT. SB 566 Perry Relating to the deployment of advanced metering and meter information networks by certain non-ERCOT utilities. SB 615 Buckingham | et al. Relating to the operations and functions of the Texas Windstorm Insurance Association and the sunset review date for and programs administered by the association; authorizing a fee. SB 624 Nichols | et al. Relating to the continuation and functions of the Texas Real Estate Commission and the Texas Appraiser Licensing and Certification Board; changing fees. SB 646 Birdwell | et al. Relating to approval for purchases of property or construction projects by a state agency with self-directed semi-independent status. SB 826 Hancock Relating to rural and opportunity funds and insurance tax credits for certain investments in those funds; imposing a monetary penalty; authorizing fees. SB 936 Hancock Relating to a cybersecurity monitor for certain electric utilities. SB 1012 Zaffirini Relating to the applicability of certain electric energy storage equipment requirements to municipally owned utilities and electric cooperatives. SB 1063 Hancock Relating to the operation of the Texas Property and Casualty Insurance Guaranty Association. SB 1152 Hancock Relating to the payment of certain fees to municipalities by entities that provide telecommunications and cable or video services. SB 1153 Hancock Relating to the Texas Life and Health Insurance Guaranty Association. SB 1211 Hancock Relating to regulation of mergers and consolidations of power generation companies. SB 1358 Hancock Relating to procedures for imposing certain administrative penalties or disgorgement orders by the Public Utility Commission of Texas. SB 1497 Zaffirini Relating to the registration and regulation of brokers by the Public Utility Commission of Texas. Pending Business Public testimony will be limited to 3 minutes. If submitting written testimony, please provide 20 copies to the committee clerk with your name and bill number on each copy. You may register for this hearing using the Senate kiosk located in the extension hallways or by going to http://swrs.
